trans-unit.source: Represents the configuration element that specifies transaction flow support for a binding.
This class cannot be inherited.
This element allows you to enable or disable incoming transaction flow in an endpointâ€™s binding settings, as well as to specify the desired protocol format for incoming transactions.

> [!CAUTION] > When using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol.OleTransactions%2A> protocol to flow transactions from endpoint to endpoint, the transaction timeout can be lost if the destination endpoint attempts to flow again using any protocol other than <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol.OleTransactions%2A>.
This can cause all down-level nodes after the <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol.OleTransactions%2A> hop to timeout later than expected.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransactionFlowBindingElement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.TransactionFlowBindingElement"></xref> class with the specified protocol that is used to flow a transaction.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] choosing the protocol to be used, see [Enabling Transaction Flow](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/31a6bc6a-4ef4-45ba-a753-1efa1a19d917).
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol"></xref> value that contains the transaction protocol used in flowing a transaction.
Gets or sets whether wildcard action is set to be allowed on a transaction flow binding element to be cloned.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if wildcard action is allowed; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

To be added.
To be added.
To be added.
Creates a duplicate of this element.
This method creates a deep clone of this binding element.
A deep clone of an object creates a copy of the object and a copy of everything directly or indirectly referenced by that object.
(This is also called copying the entire object graph.) A shallow clone of an object, by contrast, is a copy of the object only.
If the object contains references to other objects, the shallow copy does not create copies of the referred objects; instead, it copies only the references to the original objects.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> that is a duplicate of this element.
To be added.
To be added.
Returns whether the transaction protocol used for transaction flow can be serialized.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the transaction protocol can be serialized; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Exports a custom policy assertion about the binding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter"></xref> to be used when exporting the policy of this binding element.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext"></xref> to be used when exporting the policy of this binding element.
context is .
Gets or sets the transaction protocol used in flowing a transaction.
[!INCLUDE[crabout](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] choosing the protocol to be used, see [Enabling Transaction Flow](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/31a6bc6a-4ef4-45ba-a753-1efa1a19d917).
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol"></xref> that specifies the transaction protocol to be used for transaction flow.
The default is <xref:System.ServiceModel.TransactionProtocol.OleTransactions*>.
